{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is taking a regimen of rifampin, isoniazid, pyrazinamide, and ethambutol for pulmonary tuberculosis. Oral contraceptives contain ethinylestradiol and progesterone. Rifampin is known to induce CYP3A4, which can lead to decreased serum levels of these hormones. Therefore, the failure of oral contraceptives in this patient is likely due to induction of CYP3A4 by rifampin.", "answer_choice": A}
